intro: Stenogyne calaminthoides var. kulaniensis, commonly known as the Kulanui false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is often found growing in rocky or coastal habitats. It plays an important ecological role in its native environment, providing nectar for native pollinators. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
